name: Cat-Cow Stretch (Spinal Mobility)
instructions: Get on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
Inhale, arch your back, drop your belly, and lift your head (Cow).
Exhale, round your back, tuck your chin towards your chest (Cat).

name: Hip Flexor Stretch (Lunge)
instructions: Kneel on the ground and step one foot forward into a lunge position.
Shift your weight forward, keeping your chest upright and hips square.
breathingTips: Exhale as you deepen into the lunge

name: Childâ€™s Pose (Lower Back Stretch)
instructions: Kneel on the floor with big toes touching and knees apart.
Sit back onto your heels, reach your hands forward, and lower your forehead to the floor.
breathingTips: Exhale as you sink deeper into the pose

name: Chest Opener (Doorway Stretch)
instructions: Stand tall, clasp your hands behind your back, and straighten your arms.
Lift your arms slightly and open your chest.
breathingTips: Exhale as you lift and open the chest

name: Wrist Stretch
instructions: Extend right arm forward with palm up.
Use left hand to gently pull back on your fingers.

name: Glute Bridge (Hip Strengthening)
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
Lift your hips towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes.

name: Kneeling Toe-Up Hamstring Stretch
instructions: Start in a kneeling position with one foot extended forward.
Flex the forward foot so the toes point upward.
Gently hinge at your hips to lean forward, keeping your back straight.
Feel the stretch along the hamstring of the extended leg.
commonMistakes: Keeping the toes relaxed instead of flexed upward
breathingTips: Inhale deeply before starting the stretch
Exhale slowly as you lean forward into the stretch

name: Standing Side Bend Stretch
instructions: Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, arms relaxed at your sides.
Raise one arm straight overhead, reaching upwards.
Lean your upper body to the opposite side of the lifted arm, keeping your torso aligned.
Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply.
Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
commonMistakes: Twisting the torso instead of bending sideways
breathingTips: Inhale as you prepare and raise your arm
Exhale as you lean into the stretch

name: Bicycle Crunch
instructions: Lie flat on your back with your hands behind your head and legs extended.
Lift your shoulders off the floor and bring one knee toward your chest while twisting your torso to bring the opposite elbow towards the knee.
Extend the opposite leg straight out, keeping it a few inches above the ground.
Switch sides, bringing the other knee towards your chest while twisting to bring the opposite elbow towards it.
Continue alternating in a smooth, controlled motion as if pedaling a bicycle.
commonMistakes: Pulling on the neck instead of twisting from the core
Using momentum instead of controlled movements
Allowing legs to drop too low, straining the lower back
breathing_tips: Exhale as you twist and bring your knee toward your elbow
